ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I have thought about something else or tried to forget it
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I did something to distract myself like watch TV or play a game.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I stayed away from people and kept my feelings to myself
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I just handled the situation on my own.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I tried to see the bright side of things and/or focus on something good that could come from the situation.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I blamed myself for causing the problem.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I blamed someone else for putting me through this problem.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I thought of ways to solve the problem.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I tried to solve the problem myself
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I screamed, cried, or hit something.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I tried to calm down by talking to myself, praying, taking a walk, or just trying to relax.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I kept thinking and wishing this had never happened
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I kept wishing that I could change what had happened.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I turned to my family, friends, or other adults to help me feel better.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer

ElementDescription: I just accepted the problem because I knew there was nothing I could do about it.
Notes: 1= Never; 2= Sometimes; 3= A lot; 4= Almost all of the time; 5=Does not want to answer
